attributes.action: Begin a UK Space Program
attributes.background:
The UK is leaving the EU, which means the ESA (European Space Agency) will no longer be the go-to for UK citizens interested in space.
Form a UK Space Program so that the UK may participate in the advancement of space related science and exploration.

attributes.action: Overhaul The New GCSE's Making Them Easier For Students Sitting Them In 2017
attributes.background: The New GCSE's Have been declared 'too hard' by the exams regulator. Students will be sitting them around June 2017 and so far Mocks and Practice papers have shown the pass rate to be low! Others have quoted that a mark lower than 50% would be required to achieve an A Grade! They are just too hard.
attributes.additional_details:
We Want The Goverment To Consider changing the Maths exams for 2017 making them less challenging for students, many experts have agreed they are simply to hard! 
Please read  the following BBC Article http://goo.gl/FCxYI7 The changes brought in my Michael Gove were exceptionally radical and don't allow children to achieve their fullest potential, Sign the petition to make the new GCSEs fairer for our kids and the leaders of the future.

attributes.action: A new ONS prevalence survey into Children's and Young People's Mental Health.
attributes.background: Office of National Statistics prevalence surveys were carried out into Children and Young People's Mental Health in 1999 & 2004.  We have no equivalent up to date information.  There are indicators of a growing problem in the UK in this area.  A new survey would highlight the need for action.
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons Health Committee, "Children's and Adolescent's mental health and CAMHS: Third Report of Session 2014-15", p17, http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmhealth/342/342.pdf
Chief Medical Officer, "Annual Report 2012: Our Children Deserve Better", ch10 p3, https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/255237/2901304_CMO_complete_low_res_accessible.pdf

attributes.action: Ban teaching children under 16 religion
attributes.background: Leaders of religious and faith based groups raise money from supporters on an unproven pretext. In any sphere of life this amounts to fraud.
attributes.additional_details: No faith based teaching should be allowed to be given to children under the age of 16. The concept of a external superior force or being is so incredible that children need early indoctrination for the idea to take hold. It is unlikely that given free will an individual would arrive at the idea that our actions our guided by an unearthly force.

attributes.action: Reduce planning restrictions when converting derelict land into amenity space
attributes.background: I am 77 year old passionate gardener trying to rescue derelict land.  It had lots of non-native invasive weeds. I have transformed the space into a haven for wildlife. Salford council have taken over a year to grant permission, costing me 6k on surveys and fees. This should be quicker and cheaper.
attributes.additional_details:
Japanese Knotweed and Himalayan Balsam, invasive weeds:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/prevent-the-spread-of-harmful-invasive-and-non-native-plants

Before and after pictures of the derelict land in question:
https://thesecretvalley.com/2014/05/27/swan/
(I am cutting down Himalayan Balsam with a scythe)

Himalayan Balsam
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/05/09/himalayan-bolsom/

Japanese knotweed
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/08/09/clearing-and-burning-the-japanese-knotweed/

attributes.action: Stop calling the new minimum wage the 'National Living Wage'.
attributes.background: The Living Wage Foundation defines the living wage as £8.25 per hour for the UK as a whole, or £9.40 in London.  While we are glad that the minimum wage has been increased to £7.20, this is not the living wage.  As such, it should be called the Minimum Wage, NOT the 'National Living Wage'.

attributes.action: Make access to mains gas a legal right for all homes and properties in the UK.
attributes.background: Many families can't access mains gas & are forced to use more expensive forms of fuel for cooking and heating. The gas network often expands when new homes are built close to the existing network, however whole communities have been left behind because they are off grid, often only by a few miles.
attributes.additional_details: Mains gas delivered via a pipeline would instantly remove the damage to the environment caused by the hundreds of millions of carbon related miles from delivery trucks polluting our towns and villages each and every year whilst travelling back and forth delivering alternative expensive fuels such as LPG and oil to off grid homes. These journeys will never stop, there is no alternative. Over 1 million properties many with children and older occupants have no access to mains gas. Thats just wrong.

attributes.action: Pedestrian crossings by all schools
attributes.background: 2incidents have happened at my daughters school recently, I have wrote to local council to ask about a pedestrian crossing and their response was until there is a fatality, the answer is no! This IS DISGRACEFUL. I petition for crossings for all parents to get their children to school safely.

attributes.action: UK public to be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.background: The UK public elect its most influential people, Prime Minister, Chancellor, Home Secretary, Lord Mayor etc as a democracy. The UK public should also be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.additional_details: The Governor of the Bank of England directly has control over the UK debt, availability of homes, interest rates. The governor also needs to have measurable objectives that his performance can be directly assessed.

attributes.action: Prevent the exclusion of primary school children due to their haircuts.
attributes.background: A Birmingham primary school pupil was suspended from his school because his haircut 'wasn't suitable for their school policy' despite looking very smart. If a child has a smart, socially acceptable haircut, they should be allowed to wear it without harassment from their school.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-birmingham-36269041

attributes.action: NOT to allow Bailiffs to enter property unless accompanied by a police officer
attributes.background: Many people today experience violent and aggressive bailiffs. To avoid assault and humiliating threats, a police officer should attend entry to any property avoiding potential physical harm to the house holder and others to remove all threats of violence or intimidation.
attributes.additional_details: That the bailiff focus on the collection procedure showing respect and non violent means using reasonable behaviour at all times.

attributes.action: Change the tax system so student loan repayments are taken before income tax.
attributes.background: Most students can not use their income tax allowance whilst studying at university and rely on borrowing money from the students loan company to cover living expenses. Therefore, repayments of this student debt should be exempt from income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
These changes would bring the following benefits:

1. Earlier repayment and reduced pressure of student debt
2. A fairer systems for those starting out in life
3. Additional encouragement for further education

attributes.action: Legalise the sale,possession and consumption of hash heesh.
attributes.background: The consumption and classification of hash heesh seem to be less contentious than the questions over weed. Discuss any remaining obstructions to the legalisation of hash.

attributes.action: NHS to employ more Psychiatrists so patients are able to have a proper diagnosis
attributes.background: How is someone able to get better without a proper diagnosis? I believe if I had been diagnosed earlier then I would be now employed and become a productive member of society.
attributes.additional_details:
My doctor and I have continually requested a consultation with the NHS for an assessment with a psychiatrist for a duration of three years.  
The government is committed to mental health care mainly targeting dementia and teenagers.  What I propose covers everyone, all genders, races and financial backgrounds.  
The treatment I have received had really upset me and frustrated my GP, friends and family who are also affected by the condition I have. Everyone should have the right to a proper diagnosis and so the required treatment can be undertaken.

attributes.action: End the PrePay RipOff. Prepay fuel bills cost £226 a year more than direct debit
attributes.background: According to the Citizens Advice Bureau prepayment meter consumers pay £226 a year more than those who use direct debit, yet these consumers are often the poorest in our society.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to require energy companies to:
1. Cut the cost of prepayment meters in line with the cheapest direct debit fuel tariffs saving consumers £226 a year
2. End debt collection by energy companies during the winter (as Scottish Energy have done)
3. Ensure homes with pensioners, disabled people and children don't have prepayment meters fitted 
4. Stop installation of prepayment meters during the winter 
5. Protect prepayment customers from disconnection as smart meters are introduced across the UK by 2020.

attributes.action: Establish protocols for all new born babies with law bound practises.
attributes.background: Our youngest daughter was born with hyperextension in her right knee. The midwife refused to touch her and had no knowledge or experience of this condition. The physio didn't have experience, the health visitors ignored us when milestones were missed. How many other children were not being supported
attributes.additional_details:
After lots of nagging and persuasion we got the referrals we needed. At almost two she was finally getting the level of care she needed. The new physio told us that children as old as four were unable to walk- this lead us to question what happened to them?
The physio gave us the idea of the protocol. There are key documents supporting children with special educational needs and disabilities but they are no good without knowledge and guidelines for less well known conditions. MAKE PROTOCOLS LAW

attributes.action: Make the BBC a subscription-only channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: In 2016, people should not be forced to have a TV licence when they may not watch BBC programming. BBC could become a subscription-only channel akin to HBO (US) or a streaming service like Netflix.

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: Increase the number of years required to be eligible for UK citizenship
attributes.background: If refugees or persons with humanitarian protection can stay in the UK for 5 years and then be eligible for UK citizenship after 5 years, it discourages those from ever returning home once it is safe to do so.
attributes.additional_details: In Norway you have to wait 7 years, in Germany you have to wait 8 years, in Switzerland 10 years, and so on. I think there is a debate to be had about increasing the number of years to be eligible for UK citizenship.

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.

attributes.action: Parliament must vote on initial aims of Brexit and then trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: The country voted 52:48 to leave the EU in June and to make Parliament sovereign in the UK. To be sovereign, Parliament must therefore be able to vote on and scrutinise the initial aims for Brexit negotiations and then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered, not leaving it to royal prerogative.
attributes.additional_details: In determining the starting point of Brexit, our elected representatives must have the chance to properly scrutinise and vote on the aims of the negotiations. MPs must engage with their constituents and all stakeholders to represent us, the people, in determining what the aims of Brexit should be. Our elected MPs should then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered so negotiations start following these aims set out by Parliament. To be truly sovereign, Parliament must play its full role in Brexit.

attributes.action: Allow freedom of movement to continue within the tech sector
attributes.background: The UK has a skills shortage when it comes to tech, and in order for us to remain the digital capital of Europe. We must allow talent to come easily into the UK. A complicated visa process will mean that talent goes elsewhere and we suffer as a result of it.

attributes.action: As with perjury, hold politicians in contempt of the realm if they lie publicly.
attributes.background:
Perjury: the offence of wilfully telling an untruth or making a misrepresentation under oath.
If you lie in court you can be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of up to 7 years. 
If you are a politician however, who lies under oath religiously to the public, then you usually receive a promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen the effect of such lies told to the country, yet those responsible for their gross misrepresentations continue to enjoy their profession having never been held legally accountable for the horrendous damage caused by their deceitful rhetoric. 

Make lying to the public, whilst in office, the same offence as lying in court.

attributes.action: Allow full legal costs to be taken into account by the Child Support Agency
attributes.background: When one partner decides to breakup a relationship and leave, taking the children and denying the other partner an acceptable level of access and/or communication, the only recourse the other partner has to achieve reasonable access to their children is to take very costly legal action.
attributes.additional_details: Also, if despite paying a reasonable level of maintenance based on previous household bills, the leaving partner uses the CSA to obtain the maximum possible then paying the resultant determination can drain any available funds to pay for legal costs. This creates a very uneven playing field and therefore, full legal costs should be taken into consideration by the CSA in order that a parent can legally fight for their rights.

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC Television Licence.
attributes.background: The BBC licence fee is a unlawful tax against watching television. The BBC should not dictate our ability to watch television such as ITV and Channel 4.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to force pupils to sing religious songs
attributes.background: It is still legal to let a school punish students (through detentions ect...) for not singing religious songs when the songs doesn't apply to their religion or they're not religious at all... this outdated law should be removed
attributes.additional_details: The law states that religious and non religious schools must take part in some form of collective worship and that it must only be of christian character which isn't reflective of the demographic

attributes.action: Monday November 12 2018  be a UK  National Public Holiday to mark the end of WW1
attributes.background: During the past four years the Gov and the UK have been commemorating many events associated with the First World War - now as we near the 100th anniversary of its end , make the Monday nearest to Remembrance Day a National Holiday for people to reflect on the conflict that had just eneded

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: Make learning a foreign language compulsory from the 1st year of primary school
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest levels of multi-linguistic speakers. By keeping up with our European neighbours we will open up travel for the individual and business for the nation. The best way to learn a foreign language is to learn continuously from a young age, when the brain is most capable.
attributes.additional_details: Communication is key in international business and the UK government wishes to see more students taking up a foreign language at university. To facilitate a future nation of polyglots we need to prioritise foreign language as a core subject for children. Starting from the age of 5, or younger, when it's easiest to learn, and to be taught continuously through to adolescence so that every future adult has at least basic secondary language skills.

attributes.action: Stop doctors striking and withdrawing emergency care
attributes.background: We ask that the government make it illegal for people who work within the medical profession to withdraw from work and strike for more than 24 hours consecutively.   We also request that anyone doing so be struck off for intentionally causing distress and refusing to treat patients

attributes.action: Introduce banking skills to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that it is important that the use of banking services be a mandatory part of the secondary school curriculum as it would appear, from anecdotal reports and observation that many teenagers simply do not understand how to use basic banking services.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of tobacco products in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco products such as cigarettes kill 100,000 people around the  the UK in one year. It also harms many other people through second hand smoking. The life expectancy of a smoker is about 10 years less than a non smoker. Wouldn't it save many more lives if you banned the sale of tobacco products?
attributes.additional_details: http://patient.info/health/smoking-the-facts

attributes.action: Increase the restriction speed for 50cc mopeds to 60mph
attributes.background: I use 60mph roads on a regular basis. I have found that other road users grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass at dangerous points of which could easily result in a threat on my life as some cars overtake and narrowly avoid a head on crash
attributes.additional_details: I have been riding my 50cc motorbike for a few months now and I have to use 60mph/40mph roads on a regular basis on my way to school. I have found that other road users in larger vehicles grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass on corners and/or dangerously close to me. There have also been some that risk a head on crash in an attempt to pass. A faster speed in my eyes would eliminate the threat that other road users oppose to slower mopeds.

attributes.action: Legalise the age of buying and smoking e-juice to 14 with parental consent
attributes.background: Vaping and smoking e-juices do not harm kids! I'm 14 years old and I stopped smoking and moved onto e-juice. This is much less harmful then cigarettes and maybe more kids might stop smoking if the legal age was dropped.

attributes.action: Declare a national day of mourning when David Attenborough dies.
attributes.background: All non-essential services stop (most offices, shops etc) in order for all to stay home and watch his programmes.

attributes.action: Changes to the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991.
attributes.background: Many dogs that are confiscated are done so because they look dangerous or because of their breed specification; Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier, I believe that they should only be destroyed if they commit an act that deems them dangerous (full on attack on a child or vulnerable person)
attributes.additional_details: What I believe should happen is that when a dog commits a crime such as attacking a child they are to be put on a 2 stage warning system, the dog is then taken for an behaviour assessment and the owners property is assessed for welfare standards. If the dog then commits the act again more serious action can be taken to change the behaviour such as rehousing the dog to a different family to see if the dog with change then if this option has failed then the dog can be destroyed.

attributes.action: make naloxone available to all opiate / opioid users in the uk.
attributes.background: I myself have almost lost my life to opiate overdoses and I have lost friends to opiate overdoses. lets do our best to stop this. This drug has absolutely no effect on people without opiates / opioids in their system.
attributes.additional_details: Naloxone is a medication used to counter the effects of opioid overdose Specifically, naloxone is used in opioid overdoses to counteract life-threatening depression of the central nervous system and respiratory system, allowing an overdose victim to breathe normally. Naloxone only works if a person has opioids in their system; the medication has no effect if opioids are absent. Naloxone has no potential for abuse.  It is a temporary drug that wears off in 20-90 minutes. (harmreduction.org)

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for those involved in the puppy farm trade.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is one of the largest contributors of animal cruelty within Britain. No animal should have to go through the distress and abusive conditions that happen within this barbaric industry. Those who take part in this trade should suffer a heavy penalty for this act of cruelty.

attributes.action: Arm all police officers with firearms, to deter and limit impact of terrorism.
attributes.background: The ability to rapidly deal with armed terrorists cannot be met by specialist units alone. Having a rapid, local, armed response is crucial to limiting the damage terrorists can do. This can only be achieved by arming all police officers.

attributes.action: Take down all "no ball games" signs; children should be outside having fun!
attributes.background: The government needs to review the use of "no ball games" signs throughout the country. We are at a cross-roads, we either allow child obesity to continue at its epidemic rate, or encourage children to play and exercise as much as possible to bring these rates down.

attributes.action: Allow first time home buyers to pay stamp duty in installments.
attributes.background: Stamp duty for first time buyers makes buying a new home prohibitive for many. The government should allow first time buyers to pay it installments, rather than having to pay it up front.
attributes.additional_details: Buying a new home is extremely difficult due to the enormous up front cost of the deposit. Even with the governmental schemes to help prospective new home owners stamp duty still poses a major hurdle to every first time home buyer. Allow them to pay it in installments.

attributes.action: Debit card charges to be set at a fair level and charges itemised on  reciept .
attributes.background:
Shop can currently charge what ever they like if a card is used .
goverment should set a max fee and ensure the fee charged is itemised on reciept

attributes.action: Government to take full admittance on the 'tainted blood scandal' & an apology.
attributes.background: The "Tainted Blood Scandal" is the event of nearly 5,000 people being infected with the Hepatitis C and 1,200 being infected with HIV, often during treatment for Haemophilia or Blood Transfusion by the NHS in the 1970s and 1980s and the subsequent government reaction.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite numerous calls from campaigners, victims and MP's over the years, successive governments in Westminster have refused to hold a Public Inquiry into the matter.

To date no government, health or pharmaceutical entity in the UK has admitted liability for the scandal and no compensation has been paid to those infected or affected. Compensation has been paid in Ireland.

attributes.action: Parliament make a full and unequivocal apology for UK's part in invading Iraq
attributes.background: There is a case for parliament to make a full unequivocal apology for going to war with USA on Iraqi, killing so many of their people and our soldiers following the outcome of Chilcot Inquiry. Be sceptical about Trident submarine replacement and other military things USA may try to pull UK into.
attributes.additional_details:
USA simply went to war with an aim of "bomb back to the stone age" countries with things they wanted. Senior US spokes persons have admitted that the motive for invasion was because Saddam was seeking to raise the price of oil. Parliament used a lie to disguise its reasons. It is time to be somewhat sceptical about what USA expects of UK. 

Now is time to apologies.

attributes.action: Pass legislation to restrict betting on referenda and general elections.
attributes.background: Shortly before the EU Referendum, bookmakers' odds for Remain were 1/4, while those for Leave were 5/1. Such odds have the potential to influence voting, irrespective of the political issues at stake. It is reported that 69 per cent of individual bets were placed on Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference: Financial Times dated 26 June 2016
"Brexit wagers set new record for non-sports bets" by Paul McClean.

attributes.action: Pass a law to allow left turns on a red light.
attributes.background: Will reduce traffic congestion and pollution from stationary traffic waiting to turn left at a red light... This road traffic law is legal in many other countries, lets introduce here in the UK...

attributes.action: Make the Chilcot Enquiry free to the public instead of costing £767
attributes.background: Taxpayers money funded the work of the Chilcot enquiry so why are we now being charged £767 for the findings?  It should be free.  The average wage in the UK is £26,500 which means that an average person would have to spend 43% of their monthly post-tax income to get access.  This is wrong.

attributes.action: If a petition gets 250,000 signatures, it should trigger a national referendum
attributes.background:
Engagement with politics is continuing to decline. Direct democracy is part of the solution. 

When an official petition receives around 250,000 signatures, it should result in an official, binding referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland, when around 0.6% of the population signs a petition, it triggers a referendum (https://www.ch.ch/en/referendum/). This system works well in a country of more than eight million people, and there is no reason why it wouldn't work well in the UK.

A committee or group should be set up to administer these petitions so they do not needlessly consume government time. Note that only a small number of petitions a year would receive the needed signatures.

attributes.action: All companies relocating to the EU to pay all tax owing to the exchequer.
attributes.background: Vodafone may quit the UK as a result of the Brexit refrendum. HMRC did a deal with them recently. If any company relocates to within the EU, HMRC must annul any deals made, audit them properly and they must pay all tax owing from the last ten years plus interest immediately.

attributes.action: Investigate UK areas of deep social dislocation and propose remedial measures
attributes.background: The result of the EU Referendum on 23 June revealed significant differences between different parts of the UK. Polls also revealed sharply constrasting social circumstances and motivations for the different votes. There appears to be a causative correlation between vote and social circumstances.
attributes.additional_details:
The poll conducted by Lord Ashcroft shows significant social, educational and age differences between the two sides of the EU Referendum votes: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/
The differences in the voting in different parts of the country are readily available.
